title: 113_hr4121
content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes entrepreneurial development programs. The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014 authorizes the use of specific programs to provide support for entrepreneurs, including entrepreneurial education, business incubation, growth acceleration, cluster development, and business training. This does not apply to services for small businesses owned by Native Americans. The Administrator shall report annually on entrepreneurial development activities to the House and Senate Small Business Committees, excluding services for small businesses owned by Indian tribes. The Administrator will annually report to the House and Senate Small Business Committees on entrepreneurial development activities, detailing program descriptions, operating procedures, and grant award processes. The Administrator will provide annual reports to the House and Senate Small Business Committees on entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions, operating procedures, grant award processes, awardees, funding obligations, and personnel details. The Administrator will provide annual reports to the House and Senate Small Business Committees on entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions, grant award amounts, funding obligations, and personnel responsible for each program. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

Section 21 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow grant recipients to market their services to individuals and small businesses.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

Section 21(a)(7)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include sharing information with State, local, Federal agencies, or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. Section 21(a)(3)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include governing data collection activities for grant recipients. Additionally, a new section (p) requires the Administrator to submit an annual report on data collection. The Administrator must report annually to the House and Senate Committees on Small Business on data collection activities related to the Small Business Development Center program. SEC. 6. MATCHMAKING AND OTHER EVENTS. Amends the Small Business Act to allow Small Business Development Centers to collect fees from private partnerships and cosponsorships. SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Amends the Small Business Act regarding equity for SBDCs. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. The Administrator shall not award grants under this section to entities that did not receive grants prior to September 30, 2014, and seek to renew them after that date. SEC. 9. DISASTER REFORMS. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses, specifically for disaster recovery assistance. The Administrator may authorize a small business development center to provide this assistance as described in subsection (c). The Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide disaster recovery assistance to out-of-state small businesses, regardless of geographic proximity. The Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide disaster recovery assistance to out-of-state small businesses affected by a declared disaster. The Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to ensure continuity of services in states affected by a declared disaster under the Stafford Act. The Small Business Act amendment allows business development centers to maintain services in disaster-affected states. The Administrator must facilitate center personnel access to recovery facilities. The Small Business Act amendment allows small business development center personnel to access disaster recovery facilities designated by the Administrator. SEC. 10. INCLUSIONS OF ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING FOR UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS. Amends the Small Business Act to include educating unemployed individuals on entrepreneurship and assisting them in starting new businesses.
